item.title: Breadth of training -> breadth of transfer (Range book review)
item.description: TLDR: this post is a short detour from the WW2 flying aces project. I took a small break from data projects to prepare for my tidyverse train the trainer certification from RStudio (read more about that here). I was recently re-reading How to Teach Programming and Other Things, and in the section titled, “Repetition vs. Deliberate practice”, a quote stood out, A meta-study conducted in 2014 [Macnamara 2014] found that “.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi! I’m Martin Frigaard, Data Scientist and Co-Founder of Paradigm Datagroup. I provide workshops, write tutorials, and build applications for anyone who works with data. I grew up in Sandy, Oregon, but I currently live in Oakland, California. How I got started I started working with statistics at the Center for Nutrition and Activity Promotion (now the Center for Healthy Communities) in 2010. During my time at CHC, I worked with the research and evaluation team on projects that investigated associations between blood pressure, obesity, and various medical conditions.
